intro: Ecbolium venosum, commonly known as the veiny ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive veined leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticulture.
